lead_paragraph: The Nets exercised the option on Coach Lawrence Frank's contract for the 2007-8 season, the team said yesterday. Frank signed a four-year, $10 million contract extension at the beginning of the 2004-5 season. This season, he led the Nets to a 49-33 record and the Atlantic Division title for the second time in three years. Under Frank, who took over midway through the 2003-4 season when Byron Scott was fired, the Nets have a 116-88 regular-season record. They are 12-14 in the playoffs, losing in this season's Eastern Conference semifinals in five games to Miami after eliminating Indiana in six games. After taking over for Scott, Frank won his first 13 games.
